page.title: 13Aycliffe School
page.content: Aycliffe School is a residential establishment for approximately 150 boys an girls in the care of the local authority. Set in 104 acres of grounds the school site is separated from the town of Newton Aycliffe by the A167. The school, which was opened in 1942 is split into three parts, Aycliffe Training School, Regional Assessment Centre an Special Unit. There are over 200 people employed in the school. On the school site are two areas. New Close and Brough Close, where some of the staff children attend local schools. The grounds includes large playing fields, some of which are for the staff children. The grounds are surrounded by wooded areas, which contain many varietes of trees and bushes. Aycliffe School is internation- ally known for success in working with children in care.
